title: Instrumentation and Control Engineer
description:
About the job

Join OSL Consulting Engineers – A Next-Gen EPC Provider

At OSL Consulting Engineers, we’re rewriting the rules of Engineering Procurement and Construction (EPC). As the consulting division of nexos, the UK’s most digitally advanced and fully integrated EPC provider, we’re pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in the world of next-gen energy.

We believe that different thinking leads to different results—and better ones at that. That’s why we challenge the conventional and strive to break the mould. With a focus on innovation, partnerships, and problem-solving, we deliver operational reality for energy projects, unlocking new levels of operational and commercial efficiencies for our clients.

As a growing business, we recognize that it’s our people who make us great. We're always on the lookout for talented individuals to join our team and contribute to our mission of redefining the EPC landscape. If you’re ready for an environment where bold ideas are encouraged, where your contributions are valued, and where you can grow and develop, OSL is the place for you.

What You'll Do:

 We’re looking for an experienced C&I Engineer to join our Hessle-based team, where you’ll play a crucial role in delivering high-quality solutions for complex projects across a variety of industries. Reporting to the Lead C&I Engineer, you’ll work alongside a multidisciplinary engineering team to create and deliver exceptional results. Here’s a glimpse into your day-to-day:

Precision Design: Take charge of creating high-level technical drawings and documentation, including calculations, ensuring every detail meets our rigorous standards, with minimal supervision.
Leadership & Guidance: Lead project teams (as needed) and provide clear direction on technical documentation requirements, while mentoring and guiding team members.
Collaboration & Review: Review documents produced by other disciplines, providing insightful and constructive feedback to ensure alignment with project goals.
Project Progress & Reporting: Provide weekly progress updates to the Lead Engineer, highlighting milestones and ensuring that tasks are on track for successful delivery.
Client Interaction: Act as a key technical liaison with clients, both on-site and off-site, for progress reporting and to provide engineering insights.
Vendor Validation: Review and validate vendor documentation, drawings, datasheets, and specifications, ensuring correctness and alignment with project standards.
Continuous Improvement: Always on the lookout for ways to improve processes, systems, and personal performance, sharing your ideas with the team to drive operational excellence.
Up-to-Date Expertise: Stay ahead of industry trends, ensuring you’re well-versed in the latest technical developments, national/international standards, and legislative requirements.

What We’re Looking For:

 We’re seeking a driven and talented C&I Engineer with the right combination of technical expertise and a passion for innovation. If you have the following qualifications and experience, we’d love to hear from you:

Education: An HNC / HND in Instrumentation & Control (or equivalent experience).
Professional Growth: Membership with a professional body, and actively working toward chartership (or already chartered).
Industry Experience: A minimum of 2 years in the Oil & Gas or other high-hazard industries, ideally having worked across all stages of a project (Concept/Feasibility, FEED, and Detailed Design).
Technical Expertise: Proven experience in producing high-quality technical drawings and documents with accuracy and attention to detail.
Collaborative Mindset: Strong communication skills and a team-focused approach, with the ability to work effectively with clients, vendors, and other engineering disciplines.
Problem Solver: A proactive, solutions-oriented mindset that looks for continuous improvement and innovation in every task.

Why Choose OSL?

 At OSL, you’ll be joining a dynamic team that values creativity, bold ideas, and continuous learning. We offer flexibility, career development, and an environment that encourages disruptive thinking. If you’re ready to shape the future of energy through innovative engineering solutions, we want you on our team.

title: Design Engineer
description:
About the job

Earthing Design Engineer (Mid-Level or Senior)

Location: Flexible – Office / Hybrid / Fully Remote

Salary: £35,000 – £45,000 per annum (negotiable depending on experience)

Job Type: Full-Time, Permanent

An exciting opportunity has become available to join a well-established, independent design consultancy operating within the multi-utility and EHV (Extra High Voltage) sectors. Known for technical excellence and collaborative culture, this organisation is expanding its specialist Earthing division and is now seeking a talented Earthing Design Engineer — open to both mid-level professionals looking to develop their expertise and senior engineers ready to take on leadership and mentoring responsibilities.

This role offers a diverse and stimulating workload, professional development opportunities, and flexibility in how and where you work. The successful candidate will be part of a multidisciplinary team delivering innovative design solutions to utility contractors, independent connection providers, and energy developers across the UK.

About the Role

You will be responsible for the design of safe and compliant earthing systems for a wide range of infrastructure projects, including:

Substations (400kV–LV)
Renewable energy sites (solar, wind)
Battery energy storage systems (BESS)
Generation and private network schemes

The role involves detailed design work using industry-leading software, interfacing with internal teams (Electrical, Protection, Civil, EHV) and external stakeholders such as DNOs, TNOs, and contractors. While primarily an office or home-based position, occasional flexibility to support site operations would be advantageous, though not essential.

You’ll also have opportunities to support AC and DC interference studies and contribute to cross-discipline technical discussions via in-house platforms and resources.

Key Responsibilities

Lead or support earthing system design projects from tender through to commissioning
Produce and validate detailed earthing studies using CDEGS (including MALZ, HIFREQ, TRALIN, SPLITS modules)
Review and approve internal and external earthing designs in accordance with relevant UK regulations and DNO policies
Collaborate closely with electrical and multi-utility teams to ensure integrated, cost-effective solutions
Provide technical support to on-site staff, clients, and independent connection providers (ICPs)
Maintain excellent client relationships and ensure high standards of communication and service
Mentor and support junior engineers and technicians, sharing knowledge and promoting continuous learning

Essential Skills & Experience

Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent technical background
Proven experience designing earthing systems for HV/EHV infrastructure
Expert user of CDEGS software (MALZ, HIFREQ, SPLITS, TRALIN)
Strong working knowledge of UK earthing standards, regulations, and DNO design policies
Proficient in AutoCAD
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to manage time, priorities, and deadlines effectively
Confident working independently and collaboratively across teams

Desirable Experience

Experience with other simulation/modelling tools (e.g. EMTP-ATP, XGSLab)
Site-based experience in:
Soil resistivity and earth resistance measurements
Earthing system commissioning and compliance surveys
Experience in lightning risk assessments and lightning protection design
Exposure to AC and DC interference analysis

What’s On Offer

Flexible working options – including fully remote, hybrid or office-based depending on your preference
Extensive training and professional development support, including access to in-house learning platforms and peer-learning forums
25 days annual leave plus 8 bank holidays, with the ability to buy/sell up to 5 extra days
Additional 5 days’ holiday awarded with length of service
Discretionary company bonus scheme
Enhanced pension contributions, up to 8% matched
Private medical insurance
Life assurance
Employee assistance programme & wellbeing portal

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a growing and forward-thinking organisation where your work has real impact. Whether you're an experienced engineer ready to lead or someone looking to step up and grow, your skills will be valued, and your career will be supported.

Ready to take the next step in your earthing design career? Apply now to find out more.

title: Network Automation Engineer
description:
About the job

Who we are looking for

A Network Automation Engineer, who will spearhead the design and development of our automation tooling, ensuring a seamless, dynamic and performant user experience.




The Network Automation team develops cutting-edge tools to revolutionise network management and operations. The team is a passionate function responsible for designing, preparing and deploying code that configures and maintains the Network and global content delivery network.




You will collaborate closely with others to bring our network automation tools to life, whilst contributing to the ongoing maintenance and support of our network automation and self-service platforms. Our technology stack is diverse, leveraging available APIs and Infrastructure as Code (IaC) to combine all network and security technologies under a vendor agnostic abstraction tier.




This is an exciting and expanding team, combining the traditional network and new development roles.




This role is eligible for inclusion in the Company’s hybrid working from home policy.




Preferred skills and experience

Proven front end development experience with JavaScript and React.
Proficient in Python development.
Familiarity with RESTful APIs, asynchronous request handling and IaC principles, including Terraform and PostgreSQL databases.
Understanding of content delivery technologies, including load-balancing, caching and cloud services.
Knowledge of networking and firewall technologies and principles.
Ability to translate business requirements into technical needs.

title: Backend Engineer
description:
About the job

Are you interested in designing world-leading sign language technology, networking with businesses, the third sector and individual professionals? Are you ready to join a small and experienced team working towards a mission to make spoken and written languages accessible to Deaf people? If you have the right skills and are socially motivated to support access for deaf people we are keen to support your application on behalf of our retained client.

This position is offered as fully remote from mainland England as will require 1 day per month in London with the team. This highly eager and talented hire is needed due to significant new contract wins and technical progress.

The Company

Our client is an exciting and fast-growing funded start-up that is bringing together AI and Sign Language. The technology is grounded in world-leading computer vision research developed at the University of Surrey. This AI product is being used with a number of major global brands that bring life-enhancing benefits to sign language users and there are already significant contracts. They are now onto the next phase and this is the holy grail: unconstrained translation for sign language.

Essential Requirements

They need a backend engineer who’s excited by solving hard problems, shipping clean code, and be an instrumental part of a fast-moving team. You’ll be working with modern tooling and helping shape the technical direction.

You should have:

Proficiency in at least one of the core languages: Rust, Go, or Kotlin. Experience with more than one is a plus, and you should be comfortable picking up new languages as needed.
Professional experience building and scaling backend systems in a commercial software environment.
A track record of designing and building efficient, scalable RESTful APIs.
Experience working with websockets and webhooks.
Experience building and maintaining public APIs that are used by external developers or customers.
A strong grasp of API security best practices and building secure-by-default systems.
Experience with both relational and NoSQL databases and understanding when to use which.
Knowledge of and experience with event-driven architectures (e.g. message queues, pub/sub, event sourcing).
A solid understanding of system design — how to build for resilience, maintainability, and scalability.
The ability to make thoughtful trade-offs between performance, cost, and complexity.
Experience working with both microservices and monoliths, and the judgment to know which to use when.
A habit of writing thorough automated tests — unit, integration, and end-to-end — as part of your development process.
A mindset that’s open to experimentation and continuous improvement.
A collaborative approach — you’re a team player who’s happy to help, share knowledge, and learn from others.

Desirable Requirements

Not required, but let us know if you have experience with any of the following:

Working with open-source video tooling like FFMPEG or GStreamer.
Implementing caching strategies to optimise system performance and database load.
Deploying, monitoring, and operating applications in cloud environments like AWS.
Familiarity with serverless platforms like AWS Lambda.
Collaborating closely with frontend, DevOps, and product teams to deliver customer-focused features.
Experience in Agile environments and contributing to iterative planning and delivery.
Setting up and maintaining CI/CD pipelines, ideally with GitHub Actions or similar tools.
Developing SDKs or libraries that enable developers to interact with APIs or services.

Responsibilities

Building an API for subtitle generation. You’ll do this by:

Identifying what internal and external applications require integration with subtitles ideally wanting to reduce and duplication across the estate
Implement a scalable REST API that could be hosted in AWS using industry standard frameworks and practices
Utilise external packages and tools to reduce workload
Write a comprehensive test suite that tests multiple scenarios
Work with the DevOps team to deploy the API and monitor the API in production
Work with the product team to capture feedback and implement improvements

Benefits

24 days’ holiday pro-rata plus bank holidays, company pension scheme
Competitive compensation and high-value equity package
Opportunity to work on cutting edge technologies and be involved at the early stages of a high growth business.
All equipment provided
Paid training after 12-24 months
Support with ATW and access to pool of interpreters
Salary to £60K for the right experience and person.

Hours

This is a full-time position of 5 days a week, with normal virtual office hours of 9am to 6pm, although flexibility is offered to suit reasonable personal circumstances. What matters most to us is strong work ethic, teamwork and delivery of high-quality output.

Please note you must have the right to work and live full-time in the UK when you apply for this

position.

We are committed to eliminating discrimination and encouraging diversity in our team. Our aim is that our team will be truly representative of all sections of society and each employee feels respected and able to give their best.

title: Software Engineer (Prototype) - Innovation R&D
description:
About the job

Who are we?

IOG, is a technology company focused on Blockchain research and development. We are renowned for our scientific approach to blockchain development, emphasizing peer-reviewed research and formal methods to ensure security, scalability, and sustainability. Our projects include decentralized finance (DeFi), governance, and identity management, aiming to advance the capabilities and adoption of blockchain technology globally.

We invest in the unknown, applying our curiosity and desire for positive change to everything we do. By fueling creativity, innovation, and progress within our teams, our products and services are designed for people to be fearless, to be changemakers.

What the role involves:

As a prototype engineer, you will be looking at developing prototype, model, simulators, at the edge between engineering and research. You will work closely with various stakeholders (architect, cryptographer, researcher, engineer) to help and shape innovation projects.


Design & develop systems from just ideas on paper
Present options and solutions at team and project meetings
Ongoing communication reflecting your project status on a periodic basis



Requirements


Who you are:


At least 3 years of experience in software development
Strong understanding of computer science fundamentals, including algorithms and data structures
Experience with blockchain technology is necessary
Experience in remote work and collaboration across different time zones
Experience in prototyping and developing ideas
Proficiency in various programming languages and functional paradigms
Knowledge of the rust programming language
Deep understanding of computer science fundamentals, including algorithms, data structures, and concurrency
Knowledge of blockchain technology and its core concepts, such as consensus mechanisms, cryptography, and smart contracts
Self motivating and self learner



Are you an IOGer?

Do you find yourself questioning the status quo? Do you tinker with ideas and long to turn those ideas into solutions? Are you able to spark thoughtful debates, bringing out the inquisitiveness in others? Does the promise of continuously growing excite you? Then get ready to reimagine everything you thought wasn't possible because that's what it means to be an IOGer - we don't set limits, we break them.

Benefits


Remote work
Laptop reimbursement
New starter package to buy hardware essentials (headphones, monitor, etc)
Learning & Development opportunities
Competitive PTO 


At IOG, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Radar Software Engineer
description:
About the job

The growing demand for safer, more efficient, and intelligent transportation systems has created a significant need for advanced sensing technologies.

At ANGOKA, we are focused on enabling intelligent transport systems (ITS) to navigate complex environments, avoid obstacles, and perform precision maneuvers, especially in situations where GPS signals are weak or visual systems are obstructed.

Our ground-breaking co-operative radar solution offers the ability for intelligent transport systems (ITS) to operate in diverse environmental conditions (e.g., darkness, fog, rain).

Radar technology is pivotal for the advancement of intelligent transport systems, offering robust, all-weather sensing that enhances safety, efficiency, and autonomy in a wide range of commercial applications.

Why join our talented team:

As we continue to create breakthroughs at the forefront of emerging technology, we are looking for an ambitious Radar Software Engineer to join some of the industry’s brightest minds dedicated to developing hardware and software solutions.

What you will do:




As a Radar Software Engineer, you will be responsible for the development and integration of cutting-edge co-operative radar systems specifically designed to enhance drone navigation and enable precision-assisted landing. 

This role will focus on both near-term and medium-term needs for radar technologies, with an emphasis on improving accuracy, safety, and reliability in dynamic environments.

You will play an instrumental role in designing, developing, and optimising software solutions for radar systems, based on the TI AWR radar platform, to provide real-time detection, tracking, communication and coordination of non-cooperative and cooperative targets.

You will work closely with a multidisciplinary team of engineers to develop high-performance, reliable radar software that meets the stringent requirements of the aerospace industry.




What we are looking for: 




A highly motivated self-starter who thrives in a dynamic environment, demonstrates initiative, and excels at independently driving projects from concept to completion.




5+ years’ demonstrable experience developing solutions in a software engineering role with experience in radar system development preferably using the TI mmWave SDK and related development tools.







Key Responsibilities:

Radar Software Development: Develop, and maintain software for TI AWR radar systems, focusing on signal processing, radar control, and system integration.
Technology Integration: Implement advanced radar systems for real-time obstacle detection, avoidance, and proximity sensing during drone flight and landing.
Cooperative Radar Design: Develop radar systems that enable drones to communicate and share data with one another in order to improve overall situational awareness and avoid collisions in dense environments.
Testing & Validation: Conduct extensive testing of radar systems in real-world scenarios (e.g., indoor/outdoor environments, urban landscapes) to ensure system robustness in diverse conditions.
Regulatory Compliance: Consideration of the relevant aviation software standards for drone operations, including any regional or international airspace regulations.




Key Skills:

Software/Embedded Systems:

Expertise in programming languages such as C/C++, Python, and embedded software development.
Experience with radar digital signal processing (DSP), including FFT, filtering, and noise reduction techniques (CFAR, Kalman filters).
Proficiency with radar simulation tools, hardware integration, and testing methodologies (Matlab / Octave).
Understanding of firmware architectures and hardware abstraction layers
Knowledge of embedded systems design patterns
Strong grasp of design patterns, code reviews, version control (Git), and testing methodologies is vital for ensuring code quality and maintainability
Develop and maintain technical documentation, including software design specifications, user manuals, and test reports.
Experience of working in an Agile development environment, participating in sprint planning, stand-ups, and retrospectives.
Knowledge of common communication protocols (I2C, SPI, UART, etc.)
Understanding TCP/IP, UDP, MQTT and other networking protocols is essential for connected devices.




Desirable:

Experience in the TI mmWave SDK and related development tools.
Expertise in Experience with drone navigation systems, autonomous flight, and landing algorithms is a plus.
Understanding of cooperative radar networks for multi-agent systems.
Experience with machine learning techniques for sensor data processing and decision-making.
Knowledge of the latest advancements in radar technology and software development practices.
Knowledge in aviation safety standards and radar certification processes.
Ability to collaborate in multi-disciplinary teams and manage project timelines.
Prior experience using collaborative tools such as confluence, miro, jira
Experience managing teams 
A collaborative mindset. Strong problem-solving skills and an eagerness to learn.
This role offers an exciting opportunity to shape the future of drone technology, making a tangible impact on autonomous flight, safety, and efficiency in the growing field of unmanned aerial vehicles.

title: Data Analyst
description:
About the job







Role Description

This is a full-time remote role for a Data Analyst at INTELLICA FREEDOM MUTUAL HR. The Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing data, applying statistical techniques, communicating insights, and developing data models to support business decisions.




Qualifications

Analytical Skills, Data Analytics, and Statistics skills
Strong Communication skills
Data Modeling proficiency
Experience with data visualization tools
Knowledge of programming languages like Python or R
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field
